stem: The nurse is preparing to enter the room of a client on airborne and contact precautions. Place the steps for donning personal protective equipment (PPE) in the correct order.

options.text: Put on the N95 respirator or mask.
Put on the goggles or face shield.

pedagogy.nclexCategory: Safety and Infection Prevention and Control

rationale.correct: The correct sequence for donning PPE is designed to ensure maximum protection for the nurse. (1) Hand hygiene. (2) Gown (protects body). (3) Mask/Respirator (protects airway). (4) Goggles/Face shield (protects eyes). (5) Gloves (protects hands and covers the gown cuffs).
rationale.incorrect: Putting on gloves before the gown is incorrect as the gown cuffs should be tucked into the gloves.
clinicalPearls: Ensure the N95 respirator is fit-tested for the specific individual before use.

questionTrap.howToOvercome: Remember that gloves are almost always the *last* item put on during donning and the *first* item taken off during doffing.

mnemonic.title: G-M-G-G
mnemonic.expansion: Gown, Mask, Goggles, Gloves (Alphabetical-ish order after hand hygiene).

reviewUnits.heading: Standard and Transmission-Based Precautions
reviewUnits.body: Nurses must follow specific donning and doffing sequences to prevent self-contamination and the spread of pathogens. Airborne precautions require an N95 and a negative pressure room.
